# TENDER TITLE:

**Maintenance of Heating, Ventilation, and Cooling Systems (HVAC) at Coutts, Alberta**

# VENDOR NOTICE

## Tender Overview
The Public Works and Government Services Canada intends to award a contract for the maintenance of Heating, Ventilation, and Cooling Systems (HVAC) at Coutts, Alberta. The requirement involves semi-annual inspections to ensure the HVAC systems are in optimal operating condition and to address operating concerns and make adjustments to programming sequences to meet changing needs.

## Tender Description
This notice is an Advance Contract Award Notice (ACAN) pursuant to subsection 6(b) of the Public Tenders and Procurement Administration Guidelines of the Government of Canada. The notice indicates to the supplier community the intention of the Government to award a contract to a pre-identified supplier, allowing other suppliers to signal their interest in bidding by submitting a statement of capabilities. If no other supplier submits a statement of capabilities that meets the requirements set out in the ACAN, the contracting officer may proceed with the award to the pre-identified supplier.

## Requirements and Specifications
The maintenance services required under this contract include:
- Semi-annual inspections
- Periodic services "as and when required" using a Task Authority (TA)
- Programming and commissioning of field panels using Tridium software
- Ensuring compatibility with existing products and maintaining specialized products

## Evaluation Criteria
The following minimum essential requirements must be demonstrated in the statement of capabilities:
- Experience in maintaining HVAC systems using Tridium software
- Familiarity with the specific software and equipment used at the Coutts/Sweet Grass Joint Border Facility
- Ability to ensure compatibility with existing products and maintaining specialized products

## Exclusions and Trade Agreements
- Only persons having the exclusive rights to supply the required goods and services will be considered.
- This procurement is subject to the Canada-Korea Free Trade Agreement.

## Standard Contract Clauses
- The contract will be awarded for a period of 2 years, with options to extend for an additional 2 one-year periods.
- The estimated contract value is $105,000.00 (GST/HST extra).

## Closing Date and Time
The closing date and time for accepting statements of capabilities is October 7, 2022, at 14:00 hours (MDT).

## Contact Information
Inquiries and statements of capabilities should be directed to Hector Ho, Supply Specialist, Public
